sub_title: Global Talent Management at HARMAN International
summary:
In the role of Global Talent Manager at HARMAN International, Nicky van Wees van Noord supports the strategic talent initiatives for HARMANS’s Lifestyle division (Consumer Audio and Car Audio business units) and all Manufacturing Operations. 

Nicky has more than 10 years’ experience in the field of Human Resources and held positions within the disciplines of Talent Acquisition, Strategic- and Operational Human Resources and Talent Management. This combined with Nicky’s diverse industry background in Consumer Electronics and Hospitality and functional experience in the fields of marketing, sales and finance, makes her a well-rounded and respected HR partner to the business. 

Furthermore, outside of HARMAN, Nicky is active at the local Fire Department as a functional leader in Logistic Management and Organizational Development as part of the Workers Council. 

Nicky holds a Bachelor of Arts (Commercial Business), a Post-Bachelor in Strategic HRM and a Lean Six Sigma Purple Belt.

profile_positions.title: Global Talent Manager & DEI - Lifestyle Division

profile_positions.description:
As HR Business Partner at Harman I am responsible for EMEA Head Quarters, based in the Netherlands and our offices in Scandinavia and the United Kingdon. In total I am supporting 200 employees/managers with 4 different legislations and social security systems. 

My main responsibilities are:
•	Active advice and assistance to management in all operational and strategic HR issues
•	Advice and support for pending and future change processes in order to meet the strategic business needs
•	Control and monitoring of the recruiting and hiring process for the region
•	Perform duties of the employer as dialogue and negotiation partner of works council (if in place) and unions
•	Participation in the implementation of new HR tools, processes and systems and drive the process for the region
•	Drive all people cycle processes for the region
•	Ensuring the implementation of the personal-political guidelines and principles 
•	Preparation of reports and statistics, as well as development of human resources data
•	Analysation of KPIs
•	Drive and participate in various HR projects for the region as well as on EMEA level
•	Drive, implement and support a workforce planning process for the region in order to meet the strategic business objectives
•	Act as the stand in for all payroll processes for the region
•	Case Manager for Dutch sickness processes in line with the 'Wet Poortwachter'
profile_positions.title: HR Business Partner - Consumer Audio EMEA

profile_positions.description:
Sales: Benelux, Italy/Greece, CEE, Rusia/CIS, MEA, Nordics, DACH and EMEA: IT, Inside Sales. 

• Performance Management: Act as facilitator to wider Belkin team, provide support structure that will facilitate value driven performance management and maintain a healthy balance between positive and negative attrition of staff.

• Partnering with leaders and managers across the business to ensure the highest levels of service to our internal customers and give seamless HR support.

• Employee Relations: Indirectly enhancing employee output by providing guidance to managers on effective employee relations and legal matters as well as managing and participating in consultations, mediations and disciplinary matters.

• Identifying areas of improvement in managing teams, providing support and guidance, ensuring personal knowledge of employment law is accurate and up to date

• Legal: In order that Belkin’s HR function and staff management is of a consistently high standard and in line with employment law by ensuring all opportunities are met with constructive seamless solutions, taking into consideration speed, cost and flexibility as well as ensuring that all initiatives are forward thinking, minimise risk and taken in line with Employment local Employment Law. 

• Project work: Taking responsibility for driving various initiatives throughout the business, such as job leveling, competency mapping, employer branding, employee value proposition, employee engagement etc.

• Learning & Development: Facilitating value driven training opportunities for employees through Personal Development Plans, Belkin Academy (learning platform for Coaching/Mentoring, Job Shadowing, Training, E-Learning and the Belkin University), yearly Talent Review, OPQ and Strength Scope.

• Talent Acquisition: Recruitment enhanced to optimize costs and attract the right talent through Supplier management, Linked-in recruitment, OPQ- and Competency based interviewing and creating of pipelines.
profile_positions.title: HR Business Partner

profile_positions.description:
Responsible for all EMEA countries in which Belkin does business in. 

• Liaising with diverse suppliers and managing administrative related work to all current and new/suggested employee benefits such as pension, health insurance and others (eg. fietsenplan, bedrijfsfitness etc). Also act as the contact person for government agencies such as the UWV. 

• Responsible to keep all employee files are set up and kept up to date at all times.

• In relation to all employee files, ensuring that all relevant data in Oracle HRMS are kept up-to-date, are accurate and reflects all changes in personal detail, compensation and benefits. Will occasionaly and structurally produce Oracle HRMS reports for divers purposes. 

• Produces HR related correspondence and documents for employees as required e.g. contracts, changes in employment details, werkgeversverklringen, general notifications etc. 

• Manages the (administration) process of all new starters and leavers, including the producing relevant documentation and act as a consultant to the involved key players. 

• Ensures all data for payroll is provided in a timely and accurate manner.

• Is responsible for managing the sickness process, including monitoring and reporting absence figures. Kept up-to-date with current sickness cases, react as a case manager to all sickness and provide guidance and consulting to all parties involved.

• Provide trainings, including planning, preparing and give divers trainings all employees or specific groups as well face-to-face as via remote control.

• Responsible for creating a yearly strategic workforce plan.
